casebody.data:
HOWE TOTTEN v. PRISCILLA STEARNS TOTTEN. Decided April 23rd, 1926.

*701The cause was argued before Borro, C. J., Pattison, Henee, Adkins, Oefutt, Digges, Paeke, and Walsii, J"J.

Elmer J. Cook and Edgar Allan Poe, for the appellant. George Weems Williams and Edward H. Burke, for the appellee. Adkins, J.,

delivered the opinion of the Court, affirming the decree, with costs to the appellee.
